metadata.title: CVE-2018-9246 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The PGObject::Util::DBAdmin module before 0.120.0 for Perl, as used inLedgerSMB through 1.5.x, insufficiently sanitizes or escapes variablevalues used as part of shell command execution, resulting in shell codeinjection via the create(), run_file(), backup(), or restore() function.The vulnerability allows unauthorized users to execute code with the sameprivileges as the running application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9246` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpgobject-util-dbadmin-perl - 0.130.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libpgobject-util-dbadmin-perl package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.130.1-1').
